original: Agrell, Gösta Fritz Henry, postmästare, Kinna, f. 21/9/86 i Västra Harg, östergötl. 1., av fabr. Frithiof (Fritz) A. o. Elin (Lilly) Henrietta Agrell. — Mog:ex. i fyra ämnen. E. o. postexp. i östra distr. 08, bitr. postexp. i Jönköp. 10, postexp. där 13, postassist. där 25, förste dito 33, kontrollör i Visby 37, postmäst. i Kinna sed. 44. Kursled. v. utbildn. av brevbär :aspir. 36-38, 40 o. 42-44, uppdrag f. iuftskyddet, v. värd f. postv. fas-tigh. i Visby o. Västervik olika tider m. m. Init:tag. t. samt ordf. i Visby postklubb under vist. i Visby, ombud f. Sv:es allm. konstfören. f. GotL 38-44, dito f. Kinnatrakten fr. 44. GM 8 st.
translated: Agrell, Gösta Fritz Henry, postmaster, Kinna, born September 21, 1886 in Västra Harg, Östergötland, son of factory worker Frithiof (Fritz) A. and Elin (Lilly) Henrietta Agrell. He completed his secondary education in four subjects. He became a temporary clerk in the eastern district in 1908, assistant clerk in Jönköping in 1910, clerk there in 1913, postal assistant there in 1925, first assistant in 1933, controller in Visby in 1937, and postmaster in Kinna in 1944. He led courses for training postal carriers from 1936-1938, 1940, and 1942-1944. He held various positions, including serving as a host for postal properties in Visby and Västervik at different times, and he was the initiator and chairman of the Visby Post Club during his stay in Visby. He was also a delegate for the Swedish Public Art Association for Gotland from 1938-1944 and for the Kinna region from 1944. He was married 8 times.
